subject: Dog Sledding
Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race (Alaska)
lead_paragraph: The defending champion Lance Mackey was the first musher out of the Yukon River checkpoint of Nulato, Alaska, in the Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race, leaving with a team that he said was not running at full throttle.“I’m not sure they’re going to have what it takes,” Mackey said of his 14-dog team before leaving Nulato to head to Kaltag, 42 miles downriver. “But I’m not giving up. A lot can happen between now and Nome.”Mackey, a 37-year-old musher from Fairbanks, was the first to reach Nulato, 700 miles into the 1,100-mile race to Nome. He arrived exactly two hours ahead of the four-time champion Jeff King, whose 16 dogs looked alert and fresh.
